ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Occurring or operating at the same time.:Treatment that combines chemotherapy with radiation therapy.

Concepts.definition: Occurring or operating at the same time.
Treatment that combines chemotherapy with radiation therapy. Chemoradiation can be concurrent or sequential.

Property.preferredName: For Nonmetastatic Disease or Disorder Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: The reason of something.:Cancer that has not spread from the primary site (place where it started) to other places in the body.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Cancer that has not spread from the primary site (place where it started) to other places in the body.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation or an event ended.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
